This thing is almost impossible to get off the runway intact.

did you just mount a cockpit as a tail fin?? 

Awesome!!!

The plane though; can\'t remember seeing anything like this before...

We have a winner!

I\'m sure everybody is quite glad to hear that this one was fictional. Flying it is like trying to balance a cow on a three legged stool.
heres my 2, they both should be easy =P

This one should be pretty easy, but it\'s my first accurate-looking replica so I\'m proud of it ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> ![F104Starfighter.png](http://i1246.photobucket.com/albums/gg615/Tarmendel/F104Starfighter.png)

> 
> This one should be pretty easy, but it\'s my first accurate-looking replica so I\'m proud of it ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> 
> 
> > ![F104Starfighter.png](http://i1246.photobucket.com/albums/gg615/Tarmendel/F104Starfighter.png)

My favorite, the F-104! Ya know, they used to put covers on the leading edges of the wings to prevent injury because they are so sharp.

Hehe yeah, first time I heard that I thought it was a joke. It\'s one of my favorite classic jets. The 'rocket with a man in it' seemed a pretty appropriate plane to make in KSP. Too bad my version doesn\'t fly so much as goes ballistic

> 
> heres my 2, they both should be easy =P

Not for me. I guess de Havilland Vampire.

Yep!, now for the other one...
The first was an Osprey tiltrotor.
Pics attatched. Believe it or not, it\'s almost as stable as the IRL version!

> 
> Pics attatched. Believe it or not, it\'s almost as stable as the IRL version!

Would that be a Heinkel He 162?
Yes. However, it has a somewhat alarming tendency to gave its front gear sink through the ground. Takes off just fine, though.
Here\'s yet another kerbalized aircraft. It\'s not entirely stock, though (Kosmos Angara, Spider Tech, Mechjeb, Novapunch)

> 
> Here\'s yet another kerbalized aircraft. It\'s not entirely stock, though (Kosmos Angara, Spider Tech, Mechjeb, Novapunch)

I don\'t know. My best guess is that it is a Tomahawk cruise missile.
Nope.

> 
> Nope.

Well, all I have left is this:

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/7DEC87Ao0Do?start=12&feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

no offense

It looks like some kind of kind of air breathing cruise missile, 

This is the closest match i can find, but i dont think its right:

![ALCMCruiseMissile.JPG](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/5/5c/ALCMCruiseMissile.JPG)

Welp, at least you got the first part right...

Hint: Look at the speed and altitude. Its performance matches the IRL version.
Project Pluto or SLAM
